title: British English Phrasal Verbs - Complete Database

take_off.meaning: to remove clothing; (of aircraft) to leave the ground and begin flying

take_up.meaning: to begin a hobby, sport, or activity; to occupy time or space

take_on.meaning: to accept a job, responsibility, or challenge; to employ someone

take_over.meaning: to gain control of something; to begin doing someone else's job

take_after.meaning: to resemble a parent or relative in appearance or character

take_back.meaning: to return something; to withdraw a statement or promise

take_out.meaning: to remove something; to invite someone to go somewhere socially

take_in.meaning: to provide shelter; to understand information; to deceive

take_away.meaning: to remove or subtract; to buy food to eat elsewhere

take_down.meaning: to write information; to remove something from a wall or high place

go_on.meaning: to continue; to happen; to talk at length

go_out.meaning: to leave home for social reasons; to stop burning; to be in a romantic relationship

go_off.meaning: to explode; to ring (alarm); to become bad (food)

go_through.meaning: to experience something difficult; to examine carefully

go_over.meaning: to review or examine; to be received in a particular way

go_up.meaning: to increase; to be built or erected

go_back.meaning: to return to a place or previous state; to extend to an earlier time

go_ahead.meaning: to proceed with something; to take place as planned

go_down.meaning: to decrease; to sink; to be received or remembered in a particular way

go_away.meaning: to leave a place; to disappear

look_after.meaning: to take care of someone or something

look_for.meaning: to search for something or someone

look_out.meaning: to be careful; to watch for danger

look_up.meaning: to search for information in a reference book; to improve

look_back.meaning: to think about the past; to remember

get_up.meaning: to rise from bed; to stand up

get_on.meaning: to board transport; to make progress; to have a good relationship

get_off.meaning: to leave transport; to escape punishment

get_over.meaning: to recover from illness or disappointment

get_through.meaning: to complete successfully; to make contact by phone

get_away.meaning: to escape; to go on holiday

get_along.meaning: to have a good relationship with someone

get_down.meaning: to make someone depressed; to descend

keep_up.meaning: to continue at the same rate; to maintain standards

keep_off.meaning: to stay away from; to avoid

keep_away.meaning: to remain at a distance; to prevent from approaching

keep_back.meaning: to prevent from approaching; to withhold

keep_out.meaning: to remain outside; to prevent from entering

keep_to.meaning: to stay within limits; to fulfill a promise or arrangement

keep_down.meaning: to control or limit; to remain at a low level

keep_in.meaning: to not reveal information; to confine

keep_at.meaning: to persist with something; to continue working

put_off.meaning: to postpone; to cause someone to lose interest

put_on.meaning: to wear clothing; to switch on; to gain weight; to pretend

put_up.meaning: to provide accommodation; to erect; to display

put_away.meaning: to store in the proper place; to save money

put_down.meaning: to place on a surface; to criticize; to kill an animal humanely

put_out.meaning: to extinguish; to inconvenience; to publish

put_back.meaning: to return to original position; to postpone

put_forward.meaning: to propose or suggest an idea

put_through.meaning: to connect by telephone; to cause to experience

turn_on.meaning: to switch on; to attack suddenly

turn_off.meaning: to switch off; to cause to lose interest

turn_up.meaning: to arrive; to increase volume; to be found

turn_out.meaning: to result; to attend an event; to switch off lights

turn_into.meaning: to transform or change into something else

turn_over.meaning: to flip to the other side; to hand over to authorities

turn_back.meaning: to return the way you came; to fold back

turn_away.meaning: to refuse entry; to look in a different direction

turn_around.meaning: to face the opposite direction; to improve a bad situation

run_into.meaning: to meet by chance; to collide with

run_out_of.meaning: to use all of something; to have no more

run_over.meaning: to hit with a vehicle; to exceed time limit

run_through.meaning: to practice; to use up quickly

run_down.meaning: to criticize; to gradually lose power; to hit with a vehicle

run_up.meaning: to accumulate debt; to approach quickly

run_off.meaning: to leave quickly; to produce copies

run_across.meaning: to find or meet by chance

run_along.meaning: to go away (often said to children)

come_across.meaning: to find by chance; to give a particular impression

come_up_with.meaning: to think of an idea or plan

come_back.meaning: to return; to become fashionable again

come_down_with.meaning: to become ill with a disease

come_out.meaning: to be published; to become known; to declare homosexuality

come_through.meaning: to survive; to be received successfully

come_round.meaning: to visit informally; to regain consciousness

bring_up.meaning: to raise children; to mention a topic

bring_back.meaning: to return something; to cause memories to return

bring_down.meaning: to reduce; to cause a government to fall

bring_forward.meaning: to reschedule to an earlier time; to propose

bring_out.meaning: to publish or launch; to emphasize qualities

bring_off.meaning: to succeed in doing something difficult

break_down.meaning: to stop functioning; to collapse emotionally; to analyze

break_up.meaning: to end a relationship; to divide into pieces

break_out.meaning: to escape; to start suddenly (war, fire)

break_off.meaning: to end abruptly; to become detached

break_through.meaning: to make an important discovery; to force a way through

break_into.meaning: to enter illegally; to suddenly begin

break_away.meaning: to escape from control; to separate from a group

break_with.meaning: to end a relationship or tradition

carry_out.meaning: to perform or complete a task

carry_away.meaning: to become overly excited or emotional

carry_off.meaning: to succeed in something difficult; to win

carry_over.meaning: to transfer or continue from one situation to another

carry_forward.meaning: to transfer to the next period (accounting)

carry_along.meaning: to bring with you; to influence

carry_back.meaning: to return something to a previous location

carry_up.meaning: to transport to a higher level

work_out.meaning: to exercise; to solve; to develop successfully

work_on.meaning: to improve or develop; to try to persuade

work_up.meaning: to develop gradually; to make oneself upset

work_off.meaning: to get rid of through activity

work_towards.meaning: to make progress toward a goal

work_at.meaning: to make an effort to improve

work_over.meaning: to examine thoroughly; to beat up

point_out.meaning: to indicate or draw attention to

point_to.meaning: to indicate direction; to suggest as evidence

fill_in.meaning: to complete a form; to substitute; to inform

fill_out.meaning: to complete a form; to become fuller

fill_with.meaning: to cause to be full of emotion

call_off.meaning: to cancel; to order to stop attacking

call_back.meaning: to return a phone call; to ask to return

call_up.meaning: to telephone; to summon for military service

call_on.meaning: to visit; to ask for assistance

call_for.meaning: to require; to demand; to collect someone

call_in.meaning: to telephone; to request help; to summon

call_out.meaning: to shout; to summon to duty

call_at.meaning: to stop at a place briefly

give_away.meaning: to donate; to reveal a secret

give_up_on.meaning: to stop believing in someone's success

pick_up.meaning: to lift; to collect; to learn; to improve

pick_at.meaning: to eat small amounts; to criticize minor faults

drop_off.meaning: to deliver; to fall asleep; to decrease

drop_back.meaning: to move to a position behind others

hold_up.meaning: to delay; to rob; to remain strong

hold_down.meaning: to keep a job; to restrain physically

hold_together.meaning: to remain united; to not break apart

hold_over.meaning: to postpone; to continue beyond scheduled time

set_up.meaning: to establish; to arrange; to frame someone

set_off.meaning: to begin a journey; to cause to explode; to enhance by contrast

set_out.meaning: to begin a journey; to intend; to arrange systematically

set_down.meaning: to record in writing; to establish rules

set_in.meaning: to begin and seem likely to continue

set_aside.meaning: to save for later; to disregard

set_forth.meaning: to state or explain formally; to begin a journey

deal_with.meaning: to handle or manage; to be about

deal_in.meaning: to buy and sell; to be involved with

make_up.meaning: to invent; to reconcile; to comprise; to apply cosmetics

make_out.meaning: to see or hear with difficulty; to understand; to claim; to kiss

make_of.meaning: to understand or form an opinion about

make_off.meaning: to leave quickly, especially after doing something wrong

make_over.meaning: to transform appearance; to transfer ownership

make_into.meaning: to transform something into something else

make_for.meaning: to move toward; to contribute to

catch_up.meaning: to reach the same level; to do work that should have been done earlier

catch_up_with.meaning: to reach someone ahead; to finally experience consequences

catch_out.meaning: to discover someone doing something wrong

cut_down.meaning: to reduce; to fell a tree

cut_off.meaning: to disconnect; to isolate; to interrupt

cut_out.meaning: to remove by cutting; to stop doing; to exclude

cut_up.meaning: to cut into pieces; to upset emotionally

cut_through.meaning: to take a shortcut; to penetrate

cut_across.meaning: to cross by taking a shortcut; to affect various groups

sentences.text: The plane will _____ at 3pm from Heathrow airport.
I've decided to _____ tennis as a hobby this year.
She _____ a lot of responsibility in her new job.
The new manager will _____ from Mr. Smith next month.
He _____ his father - they look almost identical.
I'd like to _____ what I said earlier - I was wrong.
Let me _____ you for dinner to celebrate your promotion.
The refugees were _____ by local families during the crisis.
The police _____ the suspect for questioning yesterday.
Please _____ these important points in your notebook.
The meeting _____ for three hours without a break.
Would you like to _____ for dinner this weekend?
The bomb could _____ at any moment according to experts.
Let's _____ the plan one more time before the presentation.
Can you _____ my essay and check for grammar mistakes?
House prices have _____ significantly in the last year.
We can't _____ on our promise to help them move house.
Despite the difficulties, we decided to _____ with the project.
The Titanic _____ after hitting an iceberg in 1912.
I wish this headache would _____ - I've had it all day.
Can you _____ my cat while I'm on holiday next week?
I've been _____ my keys everywhere but can't find them.
We're really _____ the summer holidays this year.
Police are _____ the cause of the mysterious fire.
_____! There's a car coming towards you very fast!
If you don't know a word, _____ it in the dictionary.
She tends to _____ people who didn't go to university.
Young children often _____ their older siblings and copy them.
Can you _____ my homework before I hand it in tomorrow?
When I _____ on my childhood, I realize how happy I was.
I always _____ at 6:30am to go jogging before breakfast.
How are you _____ with your new course at university?
Please _____ the bus at the next stop near the hospital.
It took me weeks to _____ the flu I caught last month.
How will we _____ all this work before the deadline?
The thieves managed to _____ before the police arrived.
What time did you _____ from your trip to London yesterday?
We don't earn much but we manage to _____ somehow.
I _____ really well with my new flatmates - we're good friends.
Don't let exam stress _____ you - just do your best.
Well done! _____ the good work and you'll pass the exam.
The rain _____ falling all day without stopping once.
_____ the grass! There's a sign saying not to walk on it.
Try to _____ from junk food if you want to lose weight.
The police _____ the crowds while the President's car passed.
Please _____ of the kitchen while I'm cooking dinner.
You must _____ your promise to help with the school concert.
The doctor advised him to _____ his cholesterol levels.
They decided to _____ the news until after the wedding.
She _____ me for hours with her endless complaints and stories.
Don't _____ until tomorrow what you can do today - start now!
_____ your coat - it's freezing outside this morning.
We can _____ you for the night if you miss your train home.
Please _____ your toys when you've finished playing with them.
The teacher had to _____ the phone during the lesson.
Firefighters managed to _____ the blaze before it spread.
Can you _____ the meeting for an hour? I'm running late.
She _____ an interesting idea at the conference yesterday.
Could you _____ me to the manager, please? It's urgent.
I don't know how she _____ his rude behavior for so long.
Can you _____ the lights when you come in? It's dark.
Don't forget to _____ your computer before you leave work.
Could you _____ the volume? I can't hear the TV properly.
Please _____ the music - the neighbors are complaining again!
Over 500 people _____ for the auditions for the school play.
Water _____ ice when the temperature drops below zero.
Remember to _____ your exam paper when the time is up.
It's too late to _____ now - we're already committed to the plan.
The hotel had to _____ guests because they were fully booked.
_____ and face me when I'm talking to you!
I _____ an old friend from school at the shopping center yesterday.
We've _____ coffee - could you buy some on your way home?
Be careful not to _____ the cat when you're reversing the car.
While researching, I _____ some fascinating information about Vikings.
We need to _____ a solution to this problem by tomorrow.
What time will you _____ from your trip to Paris tomorrow?
She didn't want to _____ the subject during dinner with guests.
The new policies will _____ significant changes in education.
My car _____ on the motorway and I had to call for help.
The couple _____ after twenty years of marriage.
They're planning to _____ a new business in the city center.
What time do you want to _____ for the airport tomorrow morning?
We _____ to solve the mystery but found no evidence.
Scientists will _____ experiments to test the new drug's safety.
Despite the interruption, the teacher _____ with the lesson.
I need to _____ at the gym more regularly to stay fit.
She's _____ a very important project at the moment.
Can you help me _____ this math problem? I'm completely stuck.
The teacher _____ several mistakes in my essay that I'd missed.
Please _____ this application form and return it by Friday.
They had to _____ the football match because of heavy rain.
I'll _____ you later this evening to discuss the arrangements.
Let me _____ my friend who's an expert in this field.
Don't _____ trying - you can learn anything if you practice enough!
After arguing for hours, he finally _____ and admitted I was right.
She decided to _____ her old clothes to charity.
Can you _____ some milk from the shop on your way home?
I couldn't _____ my sister from all the people in the crowd.
Stop _____ your little brother - leave him alone!
I'll _____ you at the station at 8am tomorrow morning.
